grahampaige.comment:
Motion carries six in favor zero opposed motion carried
Ms. Page added this was her first real meeting so she appreciates everyone's support through this process She says thank you all again and closed our session tonight with that Ms Coleman asked if we had any other business before we adjourned  We did have several citizens sign up for public comment for this evening Our first speaker was Ms Shelly Nunn who announced that she is running for the sixth congressional district seat that Jim Webb has vacated in Congress This is according to Delegate Toscano delegate Mark Keam and delegate Murphy from Fairfax County We also mentioned that they had written letters of recommendation supporting Shelly Nunn for congress Our next speaker for this section and we can only have two minutes each Ms Lisa Thompson  talked about a lot of local issues about teachers that are overworked a variety of things on our work session on the ninth is going to talk about compensation at least some portion of it based on our agenda packet at this point in time and asked them to keep watching and continue their attention and see if there could help out when needed Ms Judy Caroll spoke very eloquently in support of Ms Coleman who has not been elected yet to another term She has been serving in Virginia House of Delegates Since nineteen ninety two The three board members present all said something nice Ms Osborne saying that she really appreciated all her time and working together at this table Ms Acuff just wanted to agree with what Ms Osborne and thanked Ms Carroll for bringing it up and then saying how much they appreciated him too and Ms Coleman gave him several handouts about various bills he sponsored which he passed into law along several items and then went further by thanking everybody on his team by name after reading off all this information Ms Coleman said that she will truly be lost without them and thanks them so much for the opportunity to serve this area Then Dr A came with an executive session.
